reviews.review_text: We had a lovely dining experience at Published. The staff and atmosphere was perfect. Felt high caliber but still had some of that Vancouver/West Coast casualness to it. The food was really delicious, we especially loved the lamb and the chicken style mushrooms. Really recommend trying a bit of everything, we had about 7 dishes for 3 people and then 2 desserts. That was the perfect amount of food.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Dragana, were delighted you had a lovely dining experience! Thank you for your kind words and for recommending our dishes. We cant wait to serve you again soon! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. This restaurant really deserves more than one Michelin star! My family went there for dinner and the service, ambience, and food was perfect. Our waiter Lucas was so friendly and very attentive, and he made sure we were content at all times. I really loved the ambience and the environment. My family ordered ALL of the dishes (including all the starters, mains, and dessert, except for the specials) and everything was literally flawless. The dishes came out super fast, and the texture, flavourless, and display of the dishes was perfection. I could not pick out a single imperfection in any dish! I recommend everything, but especially the Chicken Fried Mitake, Summer s Bounty, Summer Bean Salad, BBQ Pork Collar, and Summer Strawberry dessert. The cost is also way more affordable than other Michelins, and the portions are larger than other restaurants. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. We will definitely be coming here again!!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Arsene, thank you so much for your kind words! It means a lot. We hope to get the chance to host you and your family again soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Amazing experience. The food was very flavourful and the service was exceptional. I would recommend the Fried Buttermilk Mushroom. Looks like chicken and taste great! We had two plates of them. The duck with foie gras was amazing and well seasoned. The hay dessert was a big surprise with the complexity of flavours from the first bite. It was delicious. But, I think it could benefit being a smaller serving as by the end of the entire desert portion my palate felt fatigued and it had a bit of a diminishing return on the experience. Still great though! I would come back again!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Anthony, thank you for the fantastic review! Were delighted you enjoyed the food and exceptional service. Your recommendations are appreciated, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

reviews.review_text: We had an extraordinary experience dining at Published on Main. Everything from the food, to the service, and the atmosphere made it obvious why this restaurant earned a Michelin Star. The standout dish to me was the octopus. This dish had a nice tang to it, and the octopus was tender and bursting with flavour. The ingredients for all dishes were nice and fresh. Particularly, the tomatoes used in the ravioli tasted homegrown - a taste unique to only the highest quality tomato. Overall, I would describe the flavour notes of our dishes to be zesty citrus. One minor thing that stuck out to me was the plating of the pork collar dish. I found it a little awkward that the pork was only on one-third of such a large plate. It looked like most of the dish was missing. Other than that, our experience at Published on Main was fantastic!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Nathaniel! Were delighted to hear that you enjoyed our food, service, and atmosphere. Your compliments mean a lot to our team. We welcome all feedback and will pass along your notes in regards to the plating of the pork collar dish. We hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: I was eager to try the food at Published on Main after it received a myriad of accolades over the last couple of years (including its Michelin star). The food, overall, was great but a few were true standouts. The bee pollen milk buns were little pieces of heaven! The morel ravioli was the best stuffed pasta I have ever had. Just incredible. Order the pasta, you wont regret it! Service was, as is expected of an establishment of this calibre, impeccable but perhaps for that very reason the restaurant did feel a bit stuffy.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Sheida, thank you for taking the time to leave a 5 star review. We hope to have the chance to host you again soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Michelin starred Publish on Main was rated the number 1 restaurant in Canada according to Canadas 100 Best last year. This year it was ranked number 3. It totally lived up to the hype. Though every dish was fantastic, if I had to point out one standout dish, it would be the wagyu carpaccio, which was a special. The aebleskiver, a mainstay on their menu, was also incredible. It surprised me with how flavourful it is. Many of the dishes had some sauce plated with them, which took them to the next level. Perhaps most surprising of all was how it didnt completely break the bank; it was about $115 per person. I was also stuffed by the end.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Greg, thank you for your glowing review! Were delighted to hear that you enjoyed the overall experience, particularly the standout wagyu carpaccio and aebleskiver. Those are some of our favorites too! We look forward to serving you again in the future. - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Snagged a last min reservation here that opened up a month before - this place is always booked months ahead. Service was very informative and attentive, the restaurant intimately lit and clean, the food amazing. We were a large group and shared a lot of dishes, I dont remember the exact names but we tried mulitple orders of- the pasta with mushrooms and kimchi, schnitzel, fried mushrooms, milk buns, burrata, squash, chips and dip, and aebleskiver(?). The pasta was very flavorful and melded together so nicely- the mushrooms were tender and the sauce.. I could drink it! I loved the aebleskiver, which was a savory herb donut that tasted like a mcd big-mac to me, it had very similar flavors and was very substantial. The schitzel, a very good large portion and crispy. The chips and dip had fish in it but it was mellowed nicely and it tasted like sour cream and onion. For dessert we got some sort of coffee mousse, which was amazing. Looking forward to coming back in the future and trying more dishes!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Lou, thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We are looking forward to welcoming you back. - Team Published

reviews.review_text: My dining experience here was one of the best I have ever had. Each dish had its own unique flavors based on uses of spices and sauces that just worked perfectly. Each dish is perfectly plated and remarkably delicious. As others here have also suggested, the waiters were attentive and friendly, even though each attended to several tables and was consistently busy. This famed establishment truly is a gem of the Vancouver dining scene.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Alfonso. This is so wonderful to hear! Thank you for choosing to dine with us - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Came here on a weekday night and the place was full. We both had a big lunch so didnt order too much from the menu, but what we had were delicious and well thought out. The daily special of the Maitaki gnocchi was our favourite. The balance of acidity, buttery creaminess and the soft pillowy gnocchi with a slight pan fried char was excellent. We (including my Italian husband) didnt think the dish needed the corn, but still, delicious. Service was attentive, and we requested for things to speed up in pace a bit as we had a three hour drive home after. They very much honoured our request, and did a good job not rushing us through but offering everything as we meandered through each course. We didnt have time for the tasting/didnt book enough in advance for it to be available, but would absolutely come back to give it a try if we ever find ourselves back in Vancouver.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi J H, thank you so much for your thoughtful review! Were delighted to hear you enjoyed your visit. Safe travels, and we look forward to welcoming you back to Vancouver in the future! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: When entering the establishment it was very loud and at first not what It was expecting from a Michelin star restaurant, a system that usually prides itself on being stuffy. However my thoughts on the the eatery changes after having their food. Their portions were large, cocktails are innovative, and staff is attentive. I would come again. However I wish they allowed parties of one for their tasting menu.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Meghan, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the overall experience. We will be sure to pass along the comments in regards to the tasting menu to our respected management team. We hope to get the chance to welcome you back soon! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Took my mom here for her birthday and had the prix fixe. Food and service were amazing, and the servers went the extra mile to make it a memorable meal for my mom. Definitely deserving of their Michelin star. Looking forward to going back soon!

We had the tasting menu course for a special occasion. Presentation of each dish was beautiful and well thought about throughout the 10 course meal. All except for 1 dessert (brunost tart) which was a bit sour for my taste, was perfect.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Jim, we are truly grateful for your kind review. Thank you for coming - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Excellent food, was cooked perfectly. All the flavors made sense. Thoroughly enjoyed all the food we had, the drinks were nicely crafted. Highly recommend the beef Striploin and milk buns.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Zane, were delighted to hear that you loved the food and drinks! Thank you for the kind words and recommendation. We cant wait to welcome you back again sometime soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Dining in Michelin star restaurants isnt something that I aim to do, but Published on Main happened to be on my radar since before they were awarded the coveted Michelin star. I dont really agree with a lot of the stars and recommendations that were made by the Michelin guide, but in the case of Published on Main, they truly do deserve the Michelin star. We were blown away by the flavors, presentation, innovative use of ingredients and exceptional customer service that we received. Featured here: Bee Pollen Milk Buns Torched Hiramasa Summer Bounty Pacific Octopus Lobster Mushroom Lasagna Chips & Dip Wagyu Beef Carpaccio Burrata Side Stripe Prawns Roasted Zucchini Cappelletti Coffee Charred Milk Ice Cream Hay We tried so many wonderful dishes but here are a few highlights: Chips & Dip: I didnt partake in this as there was a beef fat powder in it, but the meat eaters reported that this dish was phenomenal. It was creamy, with a very delicate fish flavor which was brightened with fresh dill. Roasted Zucchini: Slightly crunchy, with a hint of spice. When I inquired as to what the crunchy ingredient was, I was told that the kitchen called it crunchy cheese business! Summer Bounty: The winning dish of the evening! It had a creamy, smoky, charred flavor and a supremely tasty sauce with pecans in it. Hay: This dessert was mind blowing. Hay isnt something I would have ever thought of eating or working with in a kitchen; yet somehow they used it to make an incredibly beautiful and tasty dessert! It seemed to us that the restaurant had been quite deliberate with the order in which the dishes were served, as it seemed like the earlier dishes were more subtle in flavor and that the flavors gradually became more pronounced with subsequent dishes. We reserved about 3 months in advance and at the time that I made our reservation, I had been asked whether there were any dietary restrictions within our group. As Im Pescatarian, I made a point of mentioning that. Three months later I forgot that Id sent that information to the restaurant. The restaurant however, did not forget. We were all extremely impressed with the lengths they went to, to ensure that the food served that night would meet with my dietary restrictions. Our server brought us a hard copy of the menu and marked the dishes that were Pescatarian for me. As I also have a huge aversion to cilantro, he had also marked the dishes that had cilantro in them for me. Even when a different server was sent to our table, we found that she too had been made aware of my dietary restrictions and was very knowledgeable about which dishes contained ingredients that might not work for my diet. Also, Im someone who likes to drink a lot of hot water with my meals and I always watch for how often a server comes around to offer me more hot water. Our server at Published on Main came around several times during the evening to give me more hot water, so I was very happy with this as weve been to other upscale restaurants where they failed to refill my hot water and  I left feeling quite thirsty after our dinner. A truly remarkable restaurant, worthy of their Michelin star status. Highly recommend this place! Service:  Good Parking: Paid parking on the street. Location: 3593 Main St., Vancouver
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Josephine, thank you for for leaving such a thoughtful review! Your kind words mean the world to us. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: They definitely did not disappoint us! All of their dishes were creative and fun to devour/savour    Their staff were all very friendly, full of energy, attentive, and they made sure our time there would be great. We will for sure be back again! Our server was Lucas, and he was fantastic. Very easy to talk to, welcoming, and attentive. Thanks for your service!

We came here tonight to celebrate my belated birthday. Our server Lauren was very attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. Of all the servers we had, she made our experience very memorable. The food was delicious and there were some dishes that were more memorable than others. The overall experience was nice and presentation on everything was beautifully plated. It is quite expensive for the tasting menu as portion size are small, but it was a nice treat.

An experience to remember We had the tasting menu here on 2 different occasions. And finally came in to try the al a carte. The little bites were amazing. Lots of different flavours and textures. We also enjoyed the wine pairing. Squid was amazing. Deep fried Mushrooms delicious. Burrata was so good. The dessert were very good. The Chocolate and the Charred milk were both wonderful. Not overly sweet with a nice crunch. Super great service from all the staff. One of my favourite places to dine in Vancouver.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Elsy,  thank you so much for your kind words. Were thrilled to hear you enjoyed our a la carte menu as much as our tasting menu. We hope to continue delivering you exceptional experiences - Team Published

reviews.review_text: We were lucky enough to get a walk-in table right at the beginning of their service. We sat at the bar and got to chat with the bartenders. Everything was quite comfortable and we felt very well hosted. Each dish we had was super tasty but the standout dish was by far the salmon. Even now my mouth waters a bit thinking about it. We would definitely come back to try the tasting menu the next time we are in Vancouver.

We had a wonderful dinner at the bar ordering a la carte. The  Summer Bounty  was my favorite dish, with fresh zucchini bringing back memories of family barbecues. The kitchen ran out of ravioli, but they rolled out a new batch of fresh pasta so quickly I wouldn t have noticed if they hadn t told me. I also wholeheartedly recommend sampling from the unique cocktail menu.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Lawrence! Thank you for taking the time to leave a kind review. We hope you get the chance to sit at our bar and taste some more cocktails soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Hands down the best restaurant in Vancouver. Reservation in this restaurant will be at least a few weeks ahead of time but completely worth it. Dining room is immaculately designed and furnished for a laid back but polished atmosphere. I like that the music level is just right - not too loud and just enough for the background. There is no TV which is a great + for me. Came here as a group of 4 and what impressed me apart from the amazing taste of food is the pace of food. The waitress and kitchen really nailed the timing. We didn t feel rushed and there was also no big pause in between each plate. The food menu is very unique and diverse. A couple of different twist to European dish. Overall all very polished - personally I found that the entre meal the least impressive. It was still very good but it is not different to other fine dining places. Appetizers were my highlight because of how unique the dishes were - you definitely cannot find this elsewhere in Vancouver. Overall for its quality, the meal was modestly priced. Highly recommend to try their cocktail list as well which is also very polished and high quality.

Lovely lovely time at this restaurant. Service throughout the evening was attentive without being intrusive, and the unnamed incognito bartender was a hoot. All the dishes were tasty with the standout being the pacific octopus. They also have a $101 Patron cocktail which is maybe worth trying ;). Looking forward to visiting again!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Diane, were thrilled to hear that you had a lovely time at our restaurant! Your kind words about our attentive service and tasty dishes are truly appreciated. We cant wait to welcome you back on your next visit! The Published Team

reviews.review_text: This place deserves its spot as one of the best restaurants in Canada. The food we had were amazing. It was all balanced in terms of flavour and temperature. The service is what you would expect from a restaurant in this calibre. They were prompt and quick with any request. The server also came to check on us on correct times. The server was also very knowledgeable about their menu and gave good recommendations. The atmosphere and design of the place fit the mission and vision of the restaurant. This place is highly recommended.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Angelus, we appreciate your kind words. Come back anytime! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Really enjoyed our food, service, and atmosphere of the restaurant. Had the following items: Chips & Dip, Chicken Liver, Chicken Fried Maitake, Cappelletti, Mega Pork Rib, Roasted Manitoba Pickerel, & Hay.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi SS, thank you for your recommendations! We are happy to hear you enjoyed yourself. - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Wow what an amazing experience, prob THE best restaurant in the city. The food - what can I say - simply amazing, service - oh wow so good and we were served by so many of their staff all night so it was kinda cool and each of them were really good at it. Can t say mouth more then it s a must go to place and pretty much the entire menu lineup is simply amazing. Once more thing - the ambience is prob the best in the city. Unlike most place in YVR where you actually have to yell at each other like being in a nightclub, here the place was packed and we all could enjoy our conversations and ask about their awesome playlist ! Pls don t wait to dine here ! Bon appetit
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Nav, thank you so much for your fantastic review! Its wonderful to know that you enjoyed the food, service, and ambiance. We cant wait to welcome you back for another delightful dining experience! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Amazing people, service and food! We were able to get a reservation last min   my husband and I s top 3 w were the lamb neck, spring salmon and fried mushrooms. But honestly everything was delicious! Also all the wine pairings we got were on point. We can t wait to come back
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Grace, thank you for the kind words! Were delighted you had a great experience with our team, service, and food. We cant wait to welcome you back soon!

reviews.review_text: Second time here and perfect date night with attentive service and delicious tasting food. Plenty of tempting dishes to choose from and at the end the Halibut and the Chicken Liver stood out. Definitely worth revisiting!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Kingramen!

reviews.review_text: A really special and delicious dining experience that is worth a try! We got the Pacific Halibut (one of the best dishes Ive ever had), pork collar, schnitzel oscar, chicken maitake (the first bite tasted exactly like chicken) and the bee pollen buns.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Amanda! Thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review. We hope to see you soon.

reviews.review_text: One hundred percent the best dining experience my boyfriend and I have enjoyed! So glad we chose to spend our 8th anniversary here. The tasting menu was immaculate, with everything perfectly balanced! The drink pairings were perfect and we left feeling the right type of full, which isn t always the case with this style of dining. Thank-you to the whole team for making our anniversary so memorable.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Gabby, were happy to hear that you had such a memorable anniversary celebration with us! We look forward to welcoming you back in the future - The Published Team

reviews.review_text: I went for a long, awaited dinner with friends I dont get to see very often. The food is fantastic. The service was great. The only negative was that. Its so busy you need to get out of the restaurant within a certain amount of time wanted to lounge around a little more would definitely go back for sure. Have the chicken liver pate the best
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Tina, thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are happy to hear you had a lovely time with your friends. We have passed along the feedback in regards to our dining times to the front of house management team. We hope to see you again soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: I had a wonderful birthday night here. Amazing food and amazing people. Thank you Lucas gave me really good advice on food and wine, and made my night, will be back again. Everything is just more than a 5 star
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Candy, were thrilled you chose to celebrate your birthday with us! Lucas and the team are delighted to have been part of your special night, and we cant wait to welcome you back for another exceptional experience. - Team Published

reviews.review_text: The food was tasty and unique. Service was excellent.  We will definitely go again for our next celebration.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Terry, were delighted you enjoyed your experience! We look forward to celebrating with you again - Team Published

reviews.review_text: After dining in a number of Michelin starred restaurants in the UK and Europe, when I found out that a number of Vancouver restaurants had received stars I started my research. Coinciding with my trip to Calgary, I made reservation at Published and made my way over. Im pleased to say that the entire experience lived up to my expectations, great service, amazing cocktails and most importantly, clever and well thought out dishes showcasing locally sourced produce and executed very well. I forgot to ask their names but the bartender and gentleman who explained the dishes were superstars! If Im back in town another time, a reservation will be made.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Rakesh, were happy to hear you had a fantastic experience, from the service to the cocktails and dishes. Well be ready to welcome you again whenever youre in town!

reviews.review_text: There is a 3 month wait for a tasting menu sitting, so if you dont want to wait that long, make a reservation for the ala carte menu. Published uses a small plate, family style arrangement. 5 shared courses + dessert is sufficient for two adults, 6 if you are really hungry. The food relies on exquisite sauces, rather than strong seasonings such as onions and garlic. The presentation of each dish is beautiful. The service is friendly, helpful and prompt. The overall experience is right up there, matched only by a very few other Vancouver restaurants. All this quality does come at a price, as one might expect. Dietary restrictions: They are very accommodating. Parking: Side streets without permit parking are you best bet.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Jay Thank you for joining us and taking the time to leave a positive review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your over all dining experience. We hope to see you again soon. - Team Published

reviews.review_text: We spent four nights in Vancouver.  We made four dinner reservations at four incredible restaurants. Published on Main was on our last night, and it was a great way to conclude a 25th wedding anniversary trip. We had a lot of great dishes over four days, and PoM had some of our clear favorites.  My wife LOVED the BBQ pork collar. Im a little embarrassed to say I was impressed with the burrata - their version twisted, tweaked, and reinvented something they places have been serving for a long time.  Id also come back and just order the beef crudo again.  It was incredible. (Note - we also tried the bee pollen mik buns.  Dont get me wrong, they were delicious. Theyre fancy, glazed Hawaiin rolls with salt.  Save some room, go out on a limb, and try something in / out of your comfort zone. Itll be worth it) This was the only restaurant where we ordered desert.  My wife preferred to find a gelato place on other nights.  Their Chocolate dish came recommended, and it did not disappoint. If we were told we could only go back to one of the four restaurants we tried for dinner when we visited Vancouver, Published on Main would get the nod.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Eric, thank you for taking the time to leave a kind review. We are happy you were able to dine with us while you were in Vancouver. Come back anytime! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: What can I say besides: Perfection. Down to the details. Didn t need to ask about a thing, the attentive and knowledgeable staff of Published on Main know how to provide top notch hospitality. We tried a few of their cocktails (The Bodeguita was just the nostalgia trip I needed to take me back) and the Banana Sorbet for dessert will stick with me for the rest f my life. Thank you for a truly transcendent experience, and I will certainly be by the next time the wind blows me to your side of Canada.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Markus, we cant express how much your appreciation means to us. We are looking forward to welcoming you back the next time the wind brings you to our side of Canada. Until then, heres to more transcendent experiences! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Food was exceptional, staff lovely & attentive and the family style of sharing made it possible to try lots of yummy food! The restaurant staff spent a lot of time consulting with my husband on food choices, as he has some dietary issues. Very much appreciated!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hello! We appreciate you taking the time to leave a positive review. We are happy to hear you and your husband enjoyed the menu suggestions our team provided. We hope to see you again soon! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: So worth it to eat here when in Vancouver. Every dish was delicious, flavorful and so balanced. Ordering 5 dishes + dessert was filling for two, but the entire menu was so tasty I could ve ordered more. Would definitely want to eat here again!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Dolly Thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review! We hope to see you next time you are in Vancouver - Team Published

reviews.review_text: We recently spent a Monday evening at Published on Main, and enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere.  We sat at the bar, and the bartenders did a great job discussing options for food and drink.  Looking forward to returning next time we are in town.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Ron! Thank you for taking the time to write a positive review. We hope to get a chance to host you again next time you are in town - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Chill vibes and upbeat music make this foodies dream of a resto hum. Sitting at the bar for a casual eve brought us much romance and was peppered with the lively banter from our host. Waygu beef carpaccio and the pickerel were standouts. Cocktails brought memories and came with history and stories. We will return. Dietary restrictions: The question of any dietary restrictions is asked immediately and strictly adhered to.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Sarah, we are delighted to hear you had a great time at our bar! We cannot wait for your return - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Outstanding attention to details on the tasting menu; The server as well. My favorite was the shrimp and the fish. The Adrian cocktail (Mezcal) was also well put together. Food : 5/5
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Vince, thank you so much! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Had an over-the-top incredible experience here. Beautiful atmosphere, knowledgeable servers who seem incredibly passionate about their jobs and the restaurant. Our server treated us to a couple extra things which was unexpected but truly made our night. Tried the halibut, hiramasa, striploin, morel mushrooms, and chocolate dessert. 15/10 on all. Can t wait to go back  thanks for making our dinner so special
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Dear Madison Thank you for taking the time to leave such a positive review! We take great pride in providing our guests with a memorable dining experience, and we are delighted to hear that we were able to do so for you. Your kind words are a testament to the hard work and dedication of our team. We hope to see you soon, Team Published

reviews.review_text: Have been here a few times before and they never disappoint. The food is creative, flavourful and prepared with care. Service is warm, welcoming and non fussy. I love how they have an ala carte menu so we can order many dishes to share and try and are not locked into a tasting menu. This time we had: - fresh cheese with preserved summer berries, black currant leaf oil (number 1 fave) - japanese style milk buns with bee pollen and whipped butter (good as usual) -  freshly foraged mushrooms (special of the day) -  bison tartare -  octopus -  roasted bc halibut in a turbo egg yolk sauce with crispy cropthorn beans - chicken schnitzel with cafe au lait sauce and a bauernhof condiment -  roasted lamb loin with a morel scouse, spring legumes, and sweet onion (perfect) - aerated hay custard with green apple and chamomile (interesting) -  charred milk ice cream with raspberry disks and rye cake - nitro espresso martini and adrian Highly recommend Published on Main!

The food is pretty amazing and they do a nice job of pairing your dishes together. Since they do small plates, you get a nice sampling of their culinary prowess, but it s very easy to lose track of what is yet to come. They were really good about accommodating the two members of the group who were vegan. However, if you don t eat meat you re likely going to need a snack on the way home.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Michael! Were delighted to hear that you had a great experience and that our team did a great job accommodating the vegan members of your group. We take pride in offering a variety of small plates to provide a diverse culinary experience. Thank you again for coming! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: One of the best dining experiences Ive had in Vancouver. I can honestly say everything was a cut above. From the affable staff, to the menu, to the decor and comfy seating, not a miss at Published was found. As I have some food allergies, I was very impressed by the written menu with all items left available to me they handed me when I sat for dinner. They also called ahead for questions regarding details, which was incredibly thoughtful and considerate. It put me at ease and allowed me to focus on everything they have to offer. The cauliflower, lamb two ways and short rib were exquisite. The drinks were also brimming with creativity. The non-alcoholic mushroom soda was a particular delight. As a Michelin star restaurant now, expectations are high but prices were quite reasonable, and expectations were exceeded. This location deserves to be top of the list if youre planning a special occasion. Youll understand what I mean as soon as you walk through the door. 10/10. Will be back, again.

Mind-blowing chef tasting menu and absolutely worth the long awaited reservation. The best way to get the chef tasting is to book on the 1st of the month for 3 months in advance. The snacks, savory courses and sweet courses were all equally incredible. Highly recommend the cocktails because theyre like no other.

We celebrated my husbands birthday here and were very impressed! The food was really creative and thought out. The flavors alone we felt like wed had before at other places however it was the way they combined them together which made this experience stand out. The service was very attentive and friendly.  The sommelier was very knowledgeable in helping us choose wine which  complimented the dishes we chose. We ordered 6 dishes and 2 desserts between the 2 of us and it was a good amount! Must get the Hay dessert ... It was so good!

One of the best, if not, the best tasting menu in Vancouver. Definitely worth the price and live up the hype. Ambiance: The space was dark and intimate, making it a great choice for a special occasion. The only downside was that it can get slightly crowded when fully booked, but it s not too noisy and overall experience won t be affected. Price: The price of the tasting menu was also very reasonable. Before it was awarded a Michelin star, the 12-course tasting menu was only 125 CAD, and even now it is only 150 CAD. This is a great value compared to prices for similar dining experiences in the United States. Food (Summer 2022 menu) The courses were well-prepared, with a focus on using seasonal and locally sourced ingredients from British Columbia. The restaurant also demonstrated great technique in incorporating fermented ingredients, which added depth and complexity to the flavors. While none of the courses particularly stood out as being especially memorable, the overall execution was impressive and each course was interesting enough. The wine pairing was A LOT. I was a bit overwhelmed with the amount of drinks. Overall, I recommend the tasting menu here. As I think it has an opportunity to compete with some of the other restaurants in the US. At 150CAD, it definitely worth a visit!

We had dinner at 4 high end restaurants during our stay in Vancouver, and this was by far our favorite. The food was superb and artfully presented, all deserving of the various awards given to this restaurant. The atmosphere was also quite fun and vibrant, where we were sitting at the bar, thus getting to watch the preparation of many cool cocktails, of which we tried a couple (which were fantastic). As mentioned, the experience is a fun and vibrant scene, but with fantastic food, which is exactly what we were looking for. Of course, there are fancy high end restaurants with a fine dining experience, where the focus is entirely on the food, but this place seems to hit the mark with atmosphere, food, and service, if you are wanting a fun night out. We absolutely loved it! Highly recommend.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Gholson, were thrilled to be your favourite among restaurants in Vancouver! Thank you for your kind words about our food, cocktails, and vibrant atmosphere. We look forward to serving you again. - Team Published Warm regards,

reviews.review_text: Celebrated my birthday with the 11-course tasting menu, everything was amazing and transcendent! Flavours in every dish were perfectly balanced and well seasoned and all the ingredients used were in season to maximize the freshness of the produce ! Took all of my willpower not to lick the plates clean in public   Servers were all very attentive and polite. Also had their in-house tarragon soda and forbidden fruit cocktail, so refreshing - really tasted like the epitome of summer Can t wait to come here again for my next special occasion

We managed to get a reservation back in November 2022 and did the tasting menu and wine pairings. They also asked if wed like to upgrade our experience to incorporate foie gras and burrata into one of the dishes and we said yes, and it was amazing. It was absolutely worth the price for the unforgettable experience and we would definitely do it all over again! We left feeling so full and satisfied. Highly recommend and hope to be able to go back soon!

Holy sh*t. Where do I start? This place is a GEM. Fantastic menu, delicious, creative cocktails, and a wonderful wine list. And the food - The food was visually stunning, and every flavor was ON POINT. It is simply delicious from start to finish. Dishes are designed to be shared and tasted by all, and honestly, we tried many of them. You cant go wrong with anything they offer. The Chef is a master of his craft, and the front of house staff were ALL fantastic and friendly. Thank you for a very special dinner. I cannot wait to come back for another amazing experience!

Their menu changes every few months so some of the dishes I mentioned may not be available anymore. Everyone seems to order the milk buns here but honestly I thought they were kind of underwhelming. It s similar to some of the bread/pastries you can buy in Asian bakeries. I enjoyed the Chips & Dip appetizer though because the dip was delicious. We went here earlier this year and I loved the squash appetizer and chicken fried maitake. Last year, I had their Roast duck with seared Foie Gras and their Mascarpone & Corn Cappalletti and enjoyed it so much. Unfortunately, they werent available anymore when I went again this year. My favourite here is their dessert called Hay. Its the one dish that I will keep coming back for. Since getting their Michelin star rating though, I think the service has actually gone down. The last time I came here, our food took so long and it was so hard to flag our server. I guess its because theyre much busier than ever too. So just be prepared to wait a while for your dishes, especially on weekends. Despite the service we had during my last visit, I still highly recommend this restaurant. I enjoyed my first visit here so much that I hope my last visit was just an outlier. Their dishes are just so creative and well thought out. Definitely a must-try restaurant.
We had an amazing experience sitting at the bar. The food was great, the drinks were very good and innovative, and the service was outstanding. Would recommend!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Angie! We hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: We had a wonderful experience here. We were delighted by the attention to details when the team was taking care of us. The food was above our expectation.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Gavin, It was a pleasure hosting you, and are thrilled you had a great experience! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Publish on Main is our another go-to restaurant. It boasts a modern decor, friendly service, and incredibly fresh and flavorful dishes, especially the seafood. The prices are reasonable, and their cocktail selection is impressive. But what we love the most are their irresistible desserts  Hey  which is simply the best in town. Its a must-visit spot for a memorable dining experience.

This restaurant was wonderful; especially the service! Our server, Lucas, was very nice to us and we loved how proactive he was as he asked if we had any allergies and was interactive throughout the meal. He was also great at promoting the dishes while being honest and genuine. The food was amazing too (except for a few dishes). Hay was by far our favourite dessert. We did not expect much from it, but we devoured the whole thing once it arrived. The caviar and waffles was also amazingly made. It was so soft and delicious   The pollen bread was also so soft and yummy! I would definitely get that again. The only disappointment was the octopus dish as it was a bit too sour and salty. Some of the other dishes were wonderfully done, but it just did not fit our tastebuds. Overall, fantastic restaurant

I can t say enough good things about this restaurant. I think this *might* have just become my favourite restaurant. The quality of the food is unbelievable - my favourites are the scallops and prawns. The meat was so smooth and had a hint of sweetness - the subtle flavours were mind blowing. We had their tasting menu with wine pairing, both were phenomenal. The wine pairing complimented the dishes really well , 11 courses with 10 wine pairings which was a lot of alcohol but I didn t feel uncomfortable at all after drinking all the wine (I usually wake up with a headache if I drink too much the night before). It says a lot about their sommelier. The vibe is modern and chill. The service was amazing - truly one of the best I ve ever experienced. I highly recommend to anyone who wants to give it a try - date night, friends dinner, business chats - no matter what the occasion, you ll have a good time. I can t wait to return!

An earnest and memorable experience at the pinnacle of fine dining. The menu is extensive and cohesive, we ordered over a dozen dishes and all of them met our admittedly high expectations. Delicious morsels arrived with curated care by our sever Lucas who was engaging and effortlessly affable. The Sable fish special was a standout for me. The atmosphere was immaculate, no hint of pretention it was pretty clear that everyone on the team was committed to the pursuit of absolute patron enjoyment and I couldnt recommend this place more.

Excellent! Enjoyed the 10 course degustation with the wine pairing. Every course was delicious and beautifully presented. The drink pairing echoed each matched dish, it was very cleverly done and you could tell they took care in the matching. The somms were very knowledgeable and friendly too. Really couldn t fault the whole experience. It was wonderful.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Kaley, thank you so much! Reviews like this make our day - Team Published

reviews.review_text: I visited Published for the second time yesterday, this time for the tasting menu experience rather than the a la carte approach I took for my first visit. I loved my a la carte visit, but I felt compelled to update my review because of the experience I had with the tasting menu. I cant stress enough how sublime the tasting menu was, and how it is unequivocally the best way to experience this restaurant. The 10 courses take you on what I can only describe as a culinary odyssey of consistently mind-blowing flavour and creativity. Every course is unique, delectable, and worthwhile in its own way. The snack smorgasbord that opens the tasting menu is a brilliant start, and the trio of the beef shank broth, the side stripe shrimp, and hiramasa serves as a fairly delicate yet exceptionally flavourful lead up into the menus three savory courses. Those savory courses hit HARD - the sablefish, ravioli, and duck are mind-blowingly rich and exceptionally delicious while never feeling heavy or overwhelming. The burnost tart was a charming transition into the two desert courses, with the douglas fir malt crumb (seriously, who is this creative??) being a profoundly satisfying finish. You can really taste the thought and care that went into not only the individual recipes, but the overall structure of the menu itself and how best to shift from one course to the other. This is art in food form, the best tasting menu Ive ever had, and is as good as fine dining gets in Vancouver. Did I mention the service is exceptional, as well? Or that the wine accompaniment is a journey unto itself? The only thing left to say is that I am greatly looking forward to coming back.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Lance, we are happy to hear you enjoyed our tasting menu experience! Your feedback is truly appreciated, and we cant wait to welcome you back. Warm regards, The Published Team

reviews.review_text: Everything here is just wow. The decor, the ambience, staff, service, food are all top notch. It was my first visit tonight. Its a Wednesday and the 2 of us lined up 15 minutes before open to get walk-in seating at the bar. The food was all delicious. I love it all. Ill definitely come back to try the rest of their menu!

Yum yum yum!  Truly enjoyed this dining experience. I believe Sean was our server and he was fantastic. He gave us good recommendations and made sure we all left full.  There were 6 of us and he recommended us ordering 12 dishes to share. My favourites were the chips and dip, fried chicken maitake, scallop, brussels sprout, and the steelhead.  Can t wait to try their tasting menu next time!

What an excellent meal! Came here with a friend tonight and was really impressed. The service is impeccible- both my friend and I have food sensitivities and the care that was taken by our waitress to explain things to us, check with the kitchen and check in with us, was amazing. Everyone was so friendly and nice, it really made the dining experience that much better. The menu is good with a good number of choices. We were told that around 5 to 6 dishes is what would be recommended for us - we went with 6 which was the perfect amount. I really loved every single dish we ordered but the Squash, Waygu Carpaccio and Roasted Manitoba Pickering really stood out for me. We then had a dessert each and that was really good. I got the Hay and all of it was so tasty except for the apple balls that was buried in the custard - it left a strong after taste that I didnt really enjoy which was a shame as everything else was so good. All in all a wonderful experience and very enjoyable evening.

Simple menu but fantastic combination of flavors. Literally has a dish called Carrots and was great. Bison tartare was phenomenal. Each dish was great layering of flavors and umami. Drop everything youre doing and head here first if your in Vancouver.

Unable to book tasting menu but managed to book a la carte.  Ordered 9 dishes for 4 of us.  All of them are very good and nice surprise! Drinks are fantastic too. No wonder easily got one Michelin star.

Excellent food and definitely up to expectations. A la carte dining for two, we had: - bee pollen milk buns (sweet, soft, and scrumptious buns with a creamy smooth butter - chicken liver mousse (combination of sweet cookie and pumpkin gel with the rich savoury mousse were perfect) - hiramasa (amazingly cured fish and pickled radish. The red beet was quite bitter, though) - fresh cheese (fluffy cheese with a perfectly toasted bun and the bright flavours from the preserved blueberries and strawberries) - duck confit (crisp skin with juicy interior, great combination with the mushrooms and sunchoke and parsley puree) - lamb two ways (the braised lamb shank is to die for and pairs well with the tabbouleh salad to cut on the gamey notes. Not a big fan of the roasted lamb loin, but only because the shank was way better) - dessert: coffee mousse with the toffee crisps were a perfect combination of sweet flavours and textures. Paired well with the espresso martini Shoutout to Lucas for the great dinner and drink suggestions!

Had dinner here tonight with my wife and friends. Average cost for 4 of us was about $100 per head (before tax n tip), with a drink of beer / wine. Ordered about 3 dishes each (portions get bigger as you move down the menu). Taste was superb though be prepared to order lots as portions are small. Elenas service was very professional and friendly. A definite treat for a special occasion.

Very pleasant night with great food and services. Every dish had surprising flavors and was extremely yummy. Our waiter was very friendly and carefully explained every dish with us. 5 Stars Michelin experience.

We came here for our anniversary dinner and none of the dishes disappointed! Every single dish was really tasty and fresh. The chef personally makes the dish and carefully thinks when to serve the next dish, based on what you ordered. We figured it out because we added another of the same dish as it was super tasty. The server mentioned that they would have to talk to the chef and will have to push back our next dish. Service was really good and everyone was super friendly. 10/10 would recommend! We found out that they also received Michelin award :) Definitely will come back!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Amanda, thank you so much for choosing us for your anniversary dinner! Were delighted to hear that you enjoyed our dishes and the attentive service. Your support and kind words mean the world to us, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Managed to get a spot at the bar on a Saturday night. The hostess was very personable, and the restaurant itself was cozy and intimate without feeling claustrophobic. Our bartender/waiter was wonderful, he was so well-versed in the menu and specials and knew all the little details of each dish, including the sustainable sources which is always a plus for me. Overall, the service, food and ambience were all top notch. This place has definitely earned it s Michelin status.
Food and cocktails were excellent and our server was lovely. Had a great dinner! Vegetarian options: Lot of great vegetarian options and our server was very helpful and mindful that I am vegetarian
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Am, thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts! Were thrilled to hear you had a great time, and were glad our service team could offer you some excellent recommendations. Come back anytime! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Visited this restaurant during a trip to Vancouver and it was one of the highlights of our stay. We managed to get a reservation day-of. The food was absolutely exceptional - we ordered from the a la carte menu and tried the milk buns, roasted carrots, squash, gnocchi, trout and braised lamb neck. Every single dish was well-balanced and delicious. The standout of the night for us was the carrot dish! Would highly recommend
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your kind words Jane and for taking the time to write your recommendations! We hope to see you again next time you are in Vancouver. - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Where to start...from the moment we arrived until we left with full bellies, everything was perfect. 10 course tasting menu was amazing from start to finish. Thank you all for your hard work and dedication, it shone through in every course and cocktail. See you again.

Hard to get a reservation but it was worth it. The dishes are quite unique. They are seeved in small sharing plates so you get to try a little bit of everything. My favorite was the Aeblskiver - a sweet-savory dish that has the perfect mix of flavors.

A truly brilliant dining experience. Every dish innovative yet not alien; like meeting a new friend you feel you always knew. Room is sleek and retro/modern and somehow cozy and full of pleasantly excited energy. Stellar staff are all pros, we felt thoughtfully taken care of and really enjoyed our dinner from cocktails & wine to mains & dessert. Special occasion not required, just go.

Did the tasting menu and it was a true 11 course gem! You will NOT leave hungry and you will enjoy every single morsel of food presented to you in the most creative way. Everything is sourced locally, which is a fantastic touch. The food has a very distinct flavour and tastes exceptionally fresh. The service was exceptional, and the cocktails were delicious. This is truly a food experience that blends experimental tastes that somehow just work. It s amazing to find such a food experience in our own backyard here in Vancouver. A must try for the tasting menu so you get a bit of everything and try a bit of everything. Make sure you get the bookings early as they go quick!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Andy, thank you for the enthusiastic review! Were delighted you enjoyed our tasting menu. We look forward to hosting you again soon! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Had the 11 course tasting menu with wine pairings, amazing food and prompt service! Loved the unique flavours, creativity, and beautiful plating. The wine pairings were thoughtful, wide variety including sake, orange wine, and some BC wines. Every course was a surprise. Definitely one of the best meals Ive had.

The dishes were superb. I had a big group with me and ordered the whole menu. I can whole heartedly say I liked every dish. There were a few standouts, foie gras!  The dishes were creative and would highly recommend. The cocktails are a little on the pricey side but very good. I like my cocktails thats boozy. I would like to thank a particular server, when I told her about my GERD, she took her time to explain each ingredient in the dishes and which ingredients were acidic. I thanked her in person and would also like to say thank you here. She went above and beyond.
Had a good experience. The food wasn t pretentious like others I ve been to. It was clean, sophisticated and balanced.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much! We hope to see you soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Lucas is the goat. He was in this together with us from the very start. Squid, carrots, scallops and striploin ran the show. The Pewsey Vale 2016 Resiling was sensational and tied the vast array of dishes together. This is a restaurant you travel for

Very delicious food and terrific staff. Would absolutely recommend a stop here. All dishes were executed very well - felt like a tasting restaurant level but much more approachable from a setting and depth of menu offerings. Not surprised this got ranked one of the top restaurants in Canada, imagine it will stay here for some time. All the staff were very friendly and knowledge. Will be back.

We had the tasting menu & added the beverage tasting. The food was great, and the ingredients top quality as expected. We booked our reservations about 2 months in advance. Every course was different than the last, and the service was excellent. I would skip the beverage pairing if I did it again and order my own drinks from the bar instead.
Fantastic! We came tonight and did the Tasting Menu. The plating is beautiful as was the flavors of all the dishes we had.

Well deserved #1 rating! I ve been to Alo a few times and what stands out at Published is the more casual atmosphere and innovative flavour combinations as well as plating. The sommelier was incredibly knowledgeable and introduce me (a non drinker) to a few pairings that I actually quite enjoyed. Loved the orange wine and my partner is still thinking about the Sake. 10/10 would recommend. The only thing I personally wasn t a fan of was the Douglas fir dessert, just not a flavour for me but enjoyed by my boyfriend. The side striped prawns and torched yellow tail were standouts and the chefs selection of snacks really started the meal on a high note.

Each course was exciting to taste and beautifully prepared. Appreciated the attention to detail with the temperature/texture/flavour profiles. The service was inspired and proud, was fun to listen to them speak about the food and wine. Got a few food lessons - thank you!! The ambiance for a late night Friday service could have been a little more intimate

This is the first 5 stars Ive ever given to the restaurant in Canada. The food is elegant, delicate and smooth. 11 courses tasting menu is a wonderful journey of taste, appetizers are especially wonderful. Not like most of the restaurants in town, Published is a kind of fusion in between North Europe & East Asia, I was told their executive chef is come from Noma - the No 1 restaurant of the world, and that explains everything. Though not every course is perfect (for example, duck breast is a bit dry coz lack of fat, and salty. Same as halibut), its quality still at the top level, considering the fair cost (125 CAD / pax for tasting set), I would say it is the place that you have to try at least once if you are in Canada. It definitely deserves a Michelin star, if not 2 or 3. The tasting set definitely needs a reservation, which seems not easy now - I dont think it will be available in 2 months. But you can try walk-in for a la carte, usually there will be more seats around 8pm.

We were so excited to dine here last night and our evening did not disappoint!!  The space is beautiful and the staff were welcoming and attentive throughout our evening. Special thanks to Amanda, the manager, who looked after us so well. Also to Mia the sommelier, and to Lynne and Sean for contributing to our perfect evening. We had the 11 course tasting menu with wine pairings and every course was thoughtful and creative. We loved Mia s descriptions of each wine and we thought they paired perfectly. We are so looking forward to our next experience here.

The food is great:  gorgeous presentations and amazing flavors, with the idea being to order several of the smaller plate dishes and to share them.  Quite a variety to choose from, too. The service was outstanding, and they were all friendly, knowledgeable, and personable.  They truly made us feel special!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Gerald, thank you for taking the time to write a wonderful review! We cant wait to welcome you back for another memorable visit! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: If i read correctly, this place was supposed to be the best restaurant in Canada. It has a Michelin star. They absolutely deserve the accolades. Top-notch food and fantastic service. Got to wait by the computer to get a reservation in 2 months.

An incredible night to remember! My friend and I had the tasting menu and we were treated to a wonderful, ten course meal with a variety of flavours. The servers were attentive and professional, and I was very satisfied with the service. The sommelier provided great recommendations and we received an excellent selection of drinks that were to our taste. It was by no means cheap but you dont go to a restaurant like this based on the value for money. You go for the experience. This is worth trying at least once in your life and I am very happy I went.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Naveen, thank you for sharing your incredible night with us!  Were thrilled you enjoyed our tasting menu, attentive service, and sommeliers recommendations. We hope to welcome you back again soon! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Ive become increasingly skeptical of highly rated restaurants in Vancouver as I feel a lot of them are over-hyped and over-influenced, so when a friend recommended this place to me I was worried this would be another overrated Vancouver restaurant, buoyed by social media hype. It was not. The food was very complex and creative, yet all the dishes were very approachable, and more importantly to me (with a laymans palette) i could tell what each individual flavour and texture was while appreciating their combination. The decor was unfussy, and our server was fantastic, going so far to accomodate our somewhat accelerated schedule for the tasting menu (we had a young screaming infant waiting for us at home), without us feeling pressured. Service was kind, courteous, and thoughtful. Very deserving of its Michelin star, and should probably have a second. Simply the best food experience I have had in Vancouver (and probably Canada).
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Jonathan, thank you for your fantastic review!  Were thrilled you had a great experience and enjoyed our creative yet approachable food. Your kind words about our service mean a lot. We look forward to serving you again soon! - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Creative and Delicious! The tasting menu was top-notch and did not feature anything on the regular menu. Some of the dishes were so good that they converted non-believers (particularly of scallops) to believers! I would highly recommend trying published on main, everything was outstanding across all courses of the dinner.

Was lucky enough to get a reso before it was awarded the Michelin star. Absolutely fantastic food. Ordered like 8 or 9 things from the menu, everything is 10 out of 10. Milk buns and octopus 12 out of 10.

Tip: book ahead! We didnt have a reservation and was on a waitlist for the bar seating and got in! We were lucky. From start to finish, the dishes were brilliant! We particularly loved the octopus dish, squid dish and the chocolate dessert. Atmosphere is great for a date night.

Celebrated my husbands birthday on a late Sunday seating and was thrilled that we didnt have to wait for months to get a table. We both enjoyed the tasting menu thoroughly. Both our waiting staff (Katie) and sommelier (Michael) were very friendly and knowledgeable, without being snobbish. The setting was beautiful setting and we liked that it still had the West Coast casual vibe for such an amazing culinary experience. The food was all tasty. Some of the highlights include the first course of the first course of a selection of canapes, beef shank (amazing broth!), pickerel (my first taste) with koji butter sauce, and the beef with rosti and mushroom. The cassis sorbet dessert was spectacular!  Was not crazy about the last course of Douglas Fir malt crumble, so I felt it didnt finish strong. I agree with the earlier review that it was a little off putting that they were trying to sell the additional options, without informing you of the price. I think that part can be improved to make it a more pleasant experience. Nevertheless, I would come back again and recommend it.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Cheryl, thank you for celebrating with us! Happy to hear you enjoyed the tasting menu, and we appreciate your feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon - Team Published

reviews.review_text: Had a wonderful meal here.  My favourite dish was the AEBLESKIVER. The food here is innovative, delicious, and beautifully presented.  Cocktails were also outstanding.  Will definitely come back again.

My friend and I came here for dinner and ordered a few different dishes. They were al incredible. The duck was so tender and melted in your mouth. The flavours in both pastas were incredible! The appetizers all pleasantly surprised me too. The drink was tasty but definitely my least favourite of the night. The atmosphere is very modern and sophisticated. It definitely gave me New York vibes. The 2 hour dining limit is enforced here ~ we wanted to order dessert but were told we couldn t because we had used up the two hours. I totally understand as this place is always booked and busy and it is nice they take reservations (as a lot of places don t) and can seat you on time. Another excuse to come back to try the dessert! They did however bring two delicious sweets with the bill. This restaurant is high-end and I m definitely a frugal person but this place was definitely worth the splurge.
Truly fantastic meal and excellent cocktails. Consider yourself lucky if you get seated in Lukes section; the best server! And just treat yourself to the damn caviar! You wont regret it.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Sam, thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We will pass along your kind review to our server Lucas. Come back anytime - Team Published

reviews.review_text: I went to have brunch here at a weekend around 12. It was surprisingly not crowded and about half empty. I liked the ambience and interior design. They also have patio seating if you want. The food was very interesting with complex flavor. I got the milky bun, fried mushroom, ox tongue and their special mushroom toast. I liked the ox tongue the most as the pickled veggies goes really well with the beef. The mustard added compliments them as well. The special mushroom toast has a really good texture. The dessert wild berry sorbet contains olive oil! It was so interesting and I liked the flavor a lot. Overall it was really good but I feel like there isnt that many options for brunch.

My wife and I came for the tasting menu, and it was incredible. The array of food was of incredible quality and variety, with very rich flavours across all dishes. My personal favourites were the pickerel and the ricotta manti, but every dish was tasty and memorable. Some of the dishes even grew on me as the flavours developed over several bites. I d also like to highlight our server Lucas in particular, as he did everything he could service-wise to make our experience amazing. My wife was feeling a bit under the weather, and he checked in regularly, preemptively offered hot water and to pack some of my wife s dishes as her stomach was too unsettled to eat. Sincere thanks again to Lucas for your efforts and kindness, and for expediting our dishes so that we could leave a little more quickly to rest at home after as well. We will definitely be back in the future to hopefully enjoy the delicious options available again, together next time!
